alert.note: Alert for Haakon; Northern Jackson; Northern Meade Co Plains; Pennington Co Plains; Rapid City; Southern Meade Co Plains; Sturgis, Piedmont Foothills; Ziebach (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 05 at 8:18PM MDT until October 06 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT FRIDAY... ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 8 AM MDT FRIDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 32 will result in frost formation. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 26 possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern and southwestern South Dakota. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Cheyenne River Reservation. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 6 AM MDT Friday. For the Frost Advisory, from 1 AM to 8 AM MDT Friday. For the Freeze Watch, from Friday evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Sudden wind gusts can cause drivers to lose control, especially in lightweight or high profile vehicles. Strong winds can cause blowing dust, reduced visibility, and flying debris. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
